title: Why is the CRISPR technology called both groundbreaking and dangerous? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because it is both - and the second follows from the first. CRISPR allows precision gene editing in a way that has not been possible before. It therefore opens up a vast number of possibilities we have never had before. And, like all such great opportunities, some are good and some are dangerous. Fire can cook your food and keep you warm, but can also burn your house down and destroy forests. CRISPR is similar - some of the things we could do with is should not be done. And many things may (or, of course, may not) have unintended consequences.
